page.title: 09Church of Scot Women's Guild
page.content:
"Whole I am and whom I serve"
The aim of the Woman's Guild is to unite the women of the Church in the dedication of their lives to the Lord Jesus Christ through Worship, Fellowship and Service. The local branch meets monthly in Cranshaws School from October to April. Worship takes place in opening devotions and in an epilogue conducted by members. Speakers throughout the session cover affairs of the Church's work; Board of World Mission and Unity; Department of Ministry and Mission; and the Board of Social Responsibility. Tea, home baking and a friendly chat form an integral part of the evening. One delegate for each board attends meetings in Duns and in Edinburgh to keep the Branch informed of the work and needs of the church.
